name: K8S Clusters Management.txt - Introduction
description: This section explains that the organization has decided to migrate their Kubernetes clusters to Amazon's Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS), where the control plane (the core components that manage the cluster) is fully managed by AWS. This decision was made due to various reasons, which are not explicitly stated. The section also provides a link to a concept note that outlines the thought process behind this migration to EKS and the use of Ubuntu as the operating system.
use_cases: Migrating Kubernetes clusters to a managed service (EKS)
Offloading the management of the Kubernetes control plane to a cloud provider (AWS)
Adopting a specific operating system (Ubuntu) for the worker nodes

name: K8S Clusters Management.txt - Kubectl configuration guide
description: This section appears to provide guidance on configuring kubectl, a command-line tool for managing Kubernetes clusters, with OIDC (OpenID Connect) authentication. OIDC is an authentication protocol that allows users to securely access applications and services using a single set of credentials. The section likely explains how to set up kubectl to authenticate with an OIDC provider, enabling secure access and management of Kubernetes clusters.
use_cases: Configuring kubectl for secure access to Kubernetes clusters using OIDC authentication
Enabling single sign-on (SSO) for Kubernetes cluster management
Integrating Kubernetes cluster management with an existing OIDC identity provider
Enhancing security and access control for Kubernetes cluster operations
